alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Western Addison; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Essex, west central Lamoille, northern Addison and central Chittenden Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Milton to Essex. Movement was east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Charlotte, Winooski, Monkton Ridge, Monkton, Westford, Monkton Boro, Essex Junction Village, Williston, Mt. Philo State Park, Jericho, Hinesburg, St. George, Essex, Jericho Village, Shelburne, and Colchester. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 78 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Western Addison; Western Chittenden
